Acorn's early machines allowed a medium to be "booted" (automatically run) by executing a file called ''!BOOT'' if present (this action, "booting a disc", was also toggled with the [[Shift key|Shift]], and hence became known as ''shift-booting''). This application directory is therefore executed (run) when the machine boots (if so configured), causing its !Run file to be executed (i.e. $.!Boot.!Run in Acorn [[Path (computing)|pathname]] syntax).
